chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
y: Rbar
x: Rbar

Goal:
Rbar_mult (Rbar_opp x) (Rbar_opp y) = Rbar_mult x y

Premises:
Rbar_mult = fun x y : Rbar => match Rbar_mult' x y with | Some z => z | None => Finite 0 end : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar
Rbar_opp = fun x : Rbar => match x with | Finite x0 => Finite (- x0) | p_infty => m_infty | m_infty => p_infty end : Rbar -> Rbar
Rbar_mult_opp_l : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_mult (Rbar_opp x) y = Rbar_opp (Rbar_mult x y)
Rbar_mult_opp_r : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_mult x (Rbar_opp y) = Rbar_opp (Rbar_mult x y)
Rbar_plus_opp : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_plus (Rbar_opp x) (Rbar_opp y) = Rbar_opp (Rbar_plus x y)
Rbar_opp_le : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_le (Rbar_opp x) (Rbar_opp y) < -> Rbar_le y x
ex_Rbar_plus_opp : forall x y : Rbar, ex_Rbar_plus x y -> ex_Rbar_plus (Rbar_opp x) (Rbar_opp y)
Rbar_opp_lt : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_lt (Rbar_opp x) (Rbar_opp y) < -> Rbar_lt y x
Rbar_mult_comm : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_mult x y = Rbar_mult y x
Rbar_div = fun x y : Rbar => Rbar_mult x (Rbar_inv y) : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar
Rbar_opp_involutive : forall x : Rbar, Rbar_opp (Rbar_opp x) = x
Rbar_mult'_opp_r : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_mult' x (Rbar_opp y) = match Rbar_mult' x y with | Some z => Some (Rbar_opp z) | None => None end
Rbar_inv_opp : forall x : Rbar, x <> 0 -> Rbar_inv (Rbar_opp x) = Rbar_opp (Rbar_inv x)
Rbar_minus = fun x y : Rbar => Rbar_plus x (Rbar_opp y) : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar
ex_Rbar_minus = fun x y : Rbar => ex_Rbar_plus x (Rbar_opp y) : Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
is_Rbar_mult_unique : forall x y z : Rbar, is_Rbar_mult x y z -> Rbar_mult x y = z
is_Rbar_minus = fun x y z : Rbar => is_Rbar_plus x (Rbar_opp y) z : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
Rbar_opp_minus : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_opp (Rbar_minus x y) = Rbar_minus y x
is_finite_correct : forall x : Rbar, is_finite x < -> (exists y : R, x = y)
ex_Rbar_div = fun x y : Rbar => ex_Rbar_mult x (Rbar_inv y) : Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
is_Rbar_div = fun x y z : Rbar => is_Rbar_mult x (Rbar_inv y) z : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
N.compare_spec : forall x y : N, CompareSpec (x = y) (x < y)%N (y < x)%N (x ?= y)%N
Rbar_mult_correct : forall x y : Rbar, ex_Rbar_mult x y -> is_Rbar_mult x y (Rbar_mult x y)
Rbar_plus_correct : forall x y : Rbar, ex_Rbar_plus x y -> is_Rbar_plus x y (Rbar_plus x y)
seq.map_id : forall (T1 : Type) (s : list T1), seq.map (fun x : T1 => x) s = s
Rbar_finite_eq : forall x y : R, x = y < -> x = y
Rbar_opp_eq : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_opp x = Rbar_opp y < -> x = y
seq.cat_nseq : forall (T : Type) (n : nat) (x : T) (s : list T), seq.cat (seq.nseq n x) s = seq.ncons n x s
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.xforall_spec : forall (f : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt -> bool) (s : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) (i : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt), FSetPositive.PositiveSet.xforall f s i = true < -> FSetPositive.PositiveSet.For_all (fun x : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt => f (FSetPositive.PositiveSet.rev_append i x) = true) s
Rbar_plus'_comm : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_plus' x y = Rbar_plus' y x
Rbar_plus_comm : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_plus x y = Rbar_plus y x
Rbar_mult'_comm : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_mult' x y = Rbar_mult' y x
Rbar_le_antisym : forall x y : Rbar, Rbar_le x y -> Rbar_le y x -> x = y
seq.eq_in_filter : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (a1 a2 : ssrbool.pred (eqtype.Equality.sort T)) (s : list (eqtype.Equality.sort T)), ssrbool.prop_in1 (ssrbool.mem s) (P:=fun x : eqtype.Equality.sort T => a1 x = a2 x) (ssrbool.inPhantom (ssrfun.eqfun a1 a2)) -> seq.filter a1 s = seq.filter a2 s
seq.eq_in_count : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (a1 a2 : ssrbool.pred (eqtype.Equality.sort T)) (s : list (eqtype.Equality.sort T)), ssrbool.prop_in1 (ssrbool.mem s) (P:=fun x : eqtype.Equality.sort T => a1 x = a2 x) (ssrbool.inPhantom (ssrfun.eqfun a1 a2)) -> seq.count a1 s = seq.count a2 s
f_equal_R : forall (B : Type) (f : R -> B) (x y : R), x = y -> f x = f y
is_Rbar_plus_unique : forall x y z : Rbar, is_Rbar_plus x y z -> Rbar_plus x y = z
Rbar_div_pos = fun (x : Rbar) (y : posreal) => match x with | Finite x0 => Finite (x0 / y) | _ => x end : Rbar -> posreal -> Rbar
Rbar_mult_pos = fun (x : Rbar) (y : posreal) => match x with | Finite x0 => Finite (x0 * y) | _ => x end : Rbar -> posreal -> Rbar
is_Rbar_plus = fun x y z : Rbar => Rbar_plus' x y = Some z : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
is_Rbar_mult = fun x y z : Rbar => Rbar_mult' x y = Some z : Rbar -> Rbar -> Rbar -> Prop
eqtype.eq_sym : forall (T : eqtype.Equality.type) (x y : eqtype.Equality.sort T), eqtype.eq_op x y = eqtype.eq_op y x

```coq
unfold Rbar_mult, Rbar_opp.
destruct x, y; simpl; try rewrite Rbar_mult_comm; try rewrite Rbar_mult_opp_l; try rewrite Rbar_mult_opp_r; auto.
Qed.
```
